title: ISic003115. Funerary aedicola for Damatrios
body:
1Δαμάτρι[ος]
2Ποπλείο[υ?]
3μακαρῖτα
4χαῖρη

l.4 reg., orig. χαῖρη

1ΔΑΜΑΤΡΙ[..]
2ΠΟΠΛΕΙΟ[.]
3ΜΑΚΑΡΙΤΑ
4ΧΑΙΡΗ

l.4 reg., orig. χαῖρη

Facsimile Images

Apparatus criticus

  • Text of Brugnone2024, checked against photograph;
  • 2: Brugnone: alternatively Ποπλείο[ς]

translation

Damatrios son of Popleios, blessed one, rejoice!

commentary

The formula μακαρῖτα χαῖρε is found in another funerary epitaph at Lilybaeum, ISic003660. The second name, Popleios (i.e. Latin Publius) could either be a patronymic, or else the adoption of a Latin name as a second name, as attested in other Sicilian cases (Cic. Verr. 2.4.35, 2.5.16).

bibliography

    26.1075 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000796 Di Stefano 1984 178-179 no.193 fig.97 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002035 Manni Piraino 1976 213-215 no.1 tav.10.1 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001771 Brugnone 2024 316-318 G8.5 fig.314
Licensed under a Creative Commons-Attribution 4.0 licence.
